params.cursor: is the aforementioned cursor. It simply indicates the starting index for enumeration. The first call should pass 0, and subsequent calls should pass the returned newCursor.
params.howMany: indicates how many items should be returned. If there arent enough remaining items in the array, the function will return fewer items.

returns.wallets: address[] return array of StrategyProviderWallet addresses

returns._0: uint256 length of the strategy provider wallet array

CreatorWhitelistAdded(address).notice: emitted when a creator is added to whitelist

StrategyProviderWalletCreated(address,ad.notice: emitted when a new strategy provider wallet is created

getStrategyProviderWallets(uint256,uint2.notice: get the array of strategy provider wallet addresses

getStrategyProviderWalletsLength().notice: get the length of the strategy provider wallet array
